PixelFormat.Description: Standard value is BayerRG12Packed, however OpenCV works with 8 bit so BayerRG8 is preferred

BinningType.Description:
Binning can be used to reduce the amount of network traffic by compressing the images before sending them
This could be useful for a live preview, however this is not recommended if images are used for analysis

ExposureMode.Description:
Timed leaves the timing up to the camera
TimedTriggered lets the software decide

FrameAverage.Description: Number of frames, a single image is created by averaging the frames

MultiExposureNumber.Description: Number of exposures, a single frame is created by adding the exposures

MultiExposureInactive.Description: Time between the exposures that make up a single frame

GevSCPSPacketSize.Description:
Maximum amount of bytes per ethernet frame
A higher maximum results in better performance
The PC network adapter and router must both have Jumbo frames enabled for this to work

Gain.Description:
1 = 0.1dB gain
0->24dB: Analog gain
24->48dB: Digital gain
More gain can brighten up a dark image, however this introduces more noise
Best practice is to increase the lighting instead of gain

BlackLevel.Description:
Value between 0 to 4095 (higher = brighter picture)
Prevent clipping of the minimum value above 0
Used to bring the minimum values closer to 0 if they are shifted up by the gain
